column2: 2. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column6: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.
column8: go to the next entrance ramp.

column4: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column6: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column8: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 7. After passing a vehicle, it is safe to return to your lane when:
column4: you are at least 100 feet ahead of the vehicle you passed.
column6: you can see both headlights of the vehicle you just passed in your rearview mirror.
column8: the driver you passed slows down to let you return to your lane.

column2: 10. When a pedestrian is crossing a street guided carrying a white cane, drivers must:
column6: help the pedestrian cross the street.
column8: yield the right of way at corners only.

column6: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 12. You may not park within _____ of a stop sign.
13. If a pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green, you should:
column4: proceed unless the pedestrian is in your lane.
column6: wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.
column8: proceed because you have the right-of-way.

column2: 16. When you hear an emergency siren, you must:
column4: speed up and take the nearest exit.
column6: pull over to the side of the road and stop.
column8: pull to the right and continue at the same speed.

column2: 17. In 55 MPH traffic you are least likely to be involved in a collision if you:
column4: drive a few MPH faster than most.
column6: drive a few MPH slower than most.

column2: 18. If a bus needs to make a right turn and you are also turning right:
column4: try to turn right before the bus does.
column6: squeeze between the bus and the curb.
column8: wait until the bus turns before turning right.

column4: areas of the road that cannot be seen even when looking into mirrors.
column6: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that are easy to spot.

column4: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: traffic from all four directions must stop.

column2: 23. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column8: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 24. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column6: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column8: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 25. A driver who's being passed on the right and the left by many vehicles while driving in the center lane of an highway should:
column4: move to the lane on their left.
column6: move to the lane on their right.
